page.title: 01Exbourne and Area
page.content: In 1845 Exbourne was described as a pleasant village on the east side of the picturesque valley of the Okement river,5 miles E.S.E. of Hatherleigh. It is still so, but the 593 population has dwindled to aprox.300. The area includes the ancient Parish of Honeychurch,present electoral roll 23+2 children. It is a very rural area,having been farmed since Saxon times.Many of our farms were mentioned in the First Domesday Book.Some even retain the same acreage. The last Lord of the Manor,Sir Roper Lethbridge,died in 1919.He had built the present Village Hall in 1884,used for so many village activities.It is used as a classroom part of the week. The landscape may not have changed,but the people have;so the village has too.
